basics.name: Mohammadreza Asadi
basics.summary: Senior Software Engineer and cloud robotics developer with a strong academic background in optimization and metaheuristic algorithms. Experienced in designing scalable cloud-native systems for autonomous robotics, real-time telemetry processing, and applied combinatorial optimization.

work.summary: Key contributor to the design and deployment of a cloud robotics platform for autonomous drone management.
highlights: Designed cloud services for real-time drone telemetry using AWS (Kinesis, Firehose, Athena) and Grafana
Worked on distributed communication between drones, docking stations, and cloud infrastructure
Contributed to C++ modules for aligning live drone video streams with VR environments
Supported the first commercial deployment with operational docking stations

work.summary: Led technical execution of multiple commercial web projects.
highlights: Managed cross-functional teams and sprint cycles
Oversaw Linux servers, deployments, and backend systems
Ensured alignment between design goals and system architecture

work.summary: Backend and full-stack development for tourism and pharmaceutical platforms.
highlights: Used Docker-based containerization and automated deployment pipelines

portfolio.name: Hybrid Metaheuristic Framework for Parameter Estimation
portfolio.description: Masterâ€™s thesis project on parameter estimation in biological signaling networks using a hybrid Scatter Search and Genetic Algorithm framework.

portfolio.name: Metaheuristic Benchmarking Frameworks
portfolio.description: C# and C++ benchmarking systems for MDVRP, vessel routing, and hotel selection problems using advanced metaheuristics.
